title: Primary Care – About Us
content:
Stepping Stones Primary Care is committed to being the main point of contact for continuing care for patients within our health care system. We are dedicated to health promotion, disease prevention, health maintenance, counseling, patient education, diagnosis, and treatment.

We provide screening of all major health-related conditions. If you already have a chronic condition, we help manage it to improve your quality of life. We screen for many things, including obesity, high blood pressure, and diabetes.

If needed, we will collaborate with other health professionals by utilizing consultation or referral as appropriate to provide cost-effective health care.

We provide “FAMILY CARE” from 5 years old through geriatrics.


Request An Appointment


 

Quality Care

You’re in good hands, so make your health care a priority!

 

Reliable

You can rely on us to get YOUR “Big Picture”!

 

Personalized

We are experienced with the health care system and believe in person-centric care!


We are here for all your health care needs.

Call us today at (252) 991-7009 / 7010

title: Human Rights Committee
excerpt:
Stepping Stones Community Resources, Inc. provides a Human Rights Committee which meets quarterly. This committee discusses the rights of persons served and assists in reviewing and/or updating current policies and procedures of persons served rights.
The committee’s main objective is protecting the rights of persons served at Stepping Stones Community Resources, Inc. and is made up of past and current persons served, stakeholders and staff members.
The committee meetings are held at 3904-A Airport Drive, Wilson NC and lunch will be served.
content:
Stepping Stones Community Resources, Inc.
Substance Abuse Counseling
Behavioral/Mental Health Counseling

Human Rights Committee


Stepping Stones Community Resources, Inc. provides a Human Rights Committee which meets quarterly. This committee discusses the rights of persons served and assists in reviewing and/or updating current policies and procedures of persons served rights.

The committee’s main objective is protecting the rights of persons served at Stepping Stones Community Resources, Inc. and is made up of past and current persons served, stakeholders and staff members.

The committee meetings are held at 3904-A Airport Drive, Wilson NC and lunch will be served.

Please fill out the form below if you would like to attend one of our Human Rights Committee meeting:

 

Confidential/Privacy Policy:
Information obtained through the internet is kept strictly confidential. We make it our priority to protect your privacy and confidentiality.

Parents Guide to Getting Good Care

When a child is struggling, or his behavior worries you, it can be hard to know whether you need to reach out to a professional. And if you do seek help, what kind of professional, and what kind of treatment, are right for your child? In this guide, we take you through the steps to finding the best professional (or team) for your child, and the most appropriate treatment for the disorder or disability. Along the way, we offer things to look for and questions to ask to ensure that you’re getting the quality care your child deserves.

https://childmind.org/guide/parents-guide-getting-good-care-2/?gclid=Cj0KCQiAiKrUBRD6ARIsADS2OLl0nQ_rF8Q3-FPbFSvMdPPK45mAwYFaU3KPl9SnOLsjrO-Rqg3TingaAtMqEALw_wcB

A Checklist for Parents with Children with Mental Health Problems
http://www.rcpsych.ac.uk/healthadvice/partnersincarecampaign/checklistforparents.aspx

For Teachers: Children’s Mental Health Disorder Fact Sheet for the Classroom
http://www.bridges4kids.org/MHClassroomFactSheet.pdf

Promoting Mental Health at Home: How to Design the Perfect Meditation Room
https://www.homeadvisor.com/r/meditation-room/

Healthy Eating and Depression: How Diet May Help Protect Your Mental Health
https://www.getselfhelp.co.uk/docs/healthy%20eating%20depression.pdf

Drug Abuse and Addiction: Recognizing the Signs and Symptoms of Drug Addiction
https://www.helpguide.org/articles/addictions/drug-abuse-and-addiction.htm

Anger Management and Addiction: How to Take Charge of Anger Issues in Sobriety
http://www.swiftriver.com/anger-management-addiction/

Elderly Mental Health: How to Help Your Senior
https://www.shieldmysenior.com/elderly-mental-health/

Coping with the Loss of a Loved One
https://www.cancer.org/content/dam/CRC/PDF/Public/6036.00.pdf[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

title: Spreading Seeds
content:
Spreading Seeds, Inc. is a Non-Profit 501 (c) (3) organization located in Wilson, NC.

Spreading Seeds is where PASSION and PURPOSE come together.

Spreading Seeds is a non-profit organization created to fill the gaps in care for low-income Veterans, families, recovering addicts, and those facing a life hardship.

Spreading Seeds provides food through cooperation with the NC Food Bank. In addition, we can provide household items, small appliances, clothing, shoes, hygiene items, and furniture through our Clothing and Household Banks. Other services we offer are guidance counseling, empowerment classes, case management, fitness, nutrition, and community connection resources.

Spreading Seeds, Inc.
3904-J Airport Rd
Wilson NC 27896
Ph: (252) 520-0081

www.SpreadSeedsWithUs.com


 

Food Bank

We are here to help!

 

Clothing Bank

Don’t go without!

 

Furniture Bank

Let us know what you need!


Don’t go without the necessities in life.

Call us today at (252) 520-0081

title: Home
content:
Click here to preview NEW Integrated Health Care Service



Stepping Stones Community Resources, Inc. is committed to serving those who are fighting addiction, substance abuse, and behavioral/mental health disorders amid a principle of confidentiality. The company takes a proactive approach to ensuring the individual needs of those served with a Comprehensive Clinical Assessment and provide treatment/services such as Individual Outpatient Therapy, Substance Abuse Counseling Outpatient Treatment, Substance Abuse Intensive Outpatient Program, Case Management, DWI Services, and Stepping Stones Primary Care. Educating those we serve is key to recovery and prevention.

“A Journey of a Thousand Miles Begins with the First Step”


 

Quality Care

We are a licensed substance abuse and behavioral/mental health treatment facility providing treatment for adolescents, women and men.

 

Dependable

We are committed to providing needed services for those who have received a DWI.

 

Personalized

We help those who want to achieve their goal of living a better life.


You know you can if you get the chance….Well HERE’S YOUR CHANCE!

Call us today at (919) 269-9300

title: GED Services
content:
The General Educational Development (GED) program is designed to prepare students to take the Official GED Testing Series. To earn a high school equivalency diploma, mastery of specific skills and a total score of 2250 points or higher on the Official GED Testing Series will be necessary.


Request An Appointment


 

Dedicated

We’ll give you the tools you need for success.

 

Reliable

We are committed to helping you be successful.

 

Personalized

Let us help you achieve your goals to get a better paying job.


We can help you achieve your educational goals.

Call us today at (919) 269-9300

title: DWI Services
content:
Did you get a DWI or a Criminal Drug Charge? Well, you’ve come to the right place!


Stepping Stones Community Resources, Inc., “FIX MY DWI” Services has a state-licensed facility in Wilson, NC, to perform DWI and Substance Abuse Assessments, evaluate the results and provide recommended DWI or Substance Abuse treatment.

A DWI Assessment, also known as an Alcohol Assessment, is required of anyone who is convicted of DWI in the state of North Carolina. You cannot receive a Limited Driving Privilege without a DWI Assessment.

We also provide Out-Of-State Reviews.

If you receive a criminal drug charge, whether a misdemeanor or felony, the court will more than likely require you to get a Substance Abuse Assessment. We provide the assessment, evaluate the results, and provided recommended Substance Abuse treatment.

****Obtaining a proper assessment and treatment for a DWI or a criminal drug charge can potentially help you if obtained ahead of your court date.

We have Certified Substance Abuse Counselors to guide you through your treatment.

Treatment Options:

Alcohol & Drug Education Traffic School (ADETS)  $160

ADETS is an educational program for someone with a DWI conviction. This program is for people who don’t have an identified substance use disorder but may be at risk for these disorders.

Short-Term Treatment  20/30

Short-term substance abuse treatment consists of 20 hours of counseling covered over a minimum of 30 days. First-Time Offenders receive individual and group counseling on chemical dependency issues.

Long-Term Treatment 40/60

Long-term substance abuse treatment consists of 40 hours of counseling covered over a minimum of 60 days. Includes group and individual counseling over a longer period of time.

90 Day Treatment

Intensive outpatient treatment including group and individual counseling.

120 Day Treatment

Intensive outpatient treatment including group and individual counseling.


Request An Appointment


 

Assessment

We can help you get back on your feet and on the road.

 

Counseling

We are committed to providing needed services for those who have received a DWI.

 

Accomplishment

We’ll make sure that you are ready to drive again.


We offer FREE TRANSPORTATION to and from your assessment and treatments with us. 

Visit us at http://www.YESFixMyDWI.com or

Call us today at (855) YES FIX MY DWI that’s (855) 937-3496

title: Case Management
content:
Case Management is a service for adults, women who are pregnant and children age three (3) and older who have a serious emotional disturbance, mental illness, or a substance abuse related disorder.

Case Management assists recipients in gaining access to necessary care and medical, behavioral, social, housing and other services appropriate to their needs. It is individualized, person-centered, empowering, comprehensive, strengths-based, and outcome-focused.

The functions of Case Management include: Case Management Assessment; Person Centered Planning; Referral/Linkage; and Monitoring/Follow-up.


Request An Appointment


 

 

Comprehensive Clinical Assessment

Support and Experience

 

Substance Abuse Counseling and Outpatient Treatment (SACOT)

Strengthening Self-Confidence

 

Substance Abuse Intensive Outpatient Program (SAIOP)

Instilling Hope


We are with you through your treatment and beyond.

Call us today at (919) 269-9300

title: SAIOP
content:
Substance Abuse Intensive Outpatient Program (SAIOP) is a structured individual and group addiction activities and services that are provided at an outpatient program with the goals of assisting adults and adolescents to begin recovery and learn life skills for recovery maintenance.

The program is offered at least 3 hours a day, at least 3 days a week, with no more than 2 consecutive days between offered services, and distinguishes between those individuals needing no more than 15 hours of structured services per week.


Request An Appointment


 

Comprehensive Clinical Assessment

Support and Experience

 

Substance Abuse Counseling and Outpatient Treatment (SACOT)

Strengthening Self-Confidence

 

Case Management

Individualized and Person-Centered


We are confident we can help you.

Call us today at (919) 269-9300

title: SACOT
content:
Substance Abuse Counseling Outpatient Treatment (SACOT) is a structured individual and group addiction activities and services that are provided at an outpatient program designed to assist adults and adolescents to begin recovery and learn skills for recovery maintenance.

The program is offered at least 4 hours a day, at least 4 days a week, no more than 7 days a week with no more than 2 consecutive days between offered services, and distinguishes between those individuals needing more than 20 hours of structured services per week.


Request An Appointment


 

Comprehensive Clinical Assessment

Support and Experience

 

Substance Abuse Intensive Outpatient Program (SAIOP)

Instilling Hope

 

Case Management

Individualized and Person-Centered


We are confident we can help you.

Call us today at (919) 269-9300

title: Individual Outpatient Therapy
content:
Individual Outpatient Therapy is a specialized treatment that is personalized to the needs of the individual and recognizes the importance of the individual. We provide quality treatment in areas of anger management, mood disorders, anxiety disorders, attention deficit hyperactivity disorders (ADHD), behavioral disorders, post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), stress management, substance abuse disorders, gambling addiction disorders, eating disorders, and obsessive-compulsive disorders. We want to help you, no matter the situation.

We specialize in children, adolescents, veterans, and adults with our Individual Outpatient Therapy.


Request An Appointment


 

Individual Outpatient Therapy

Strengthening Self-Confidence

 

Individual Outpatient Therapy

Instilling Hope

 

Individual Outpatient Therapy

Individualized and Person-Centered


We personalize your individual treatment.

Call us today at (919) 269-9300

title: Behavioral/Mental Health
content:
Behavioral/Mental Health affects how we think, feel, and act. It includes our emotional, mental, and overall well-being. It also controls how we handle stress, make choices, and relate to others. Your thinking, mood, and behavior could be affected if you experience mental health problems.

There are many causes that can play apart in behavioral/mental health problems, including:

  • Family history of mental health problems
  • Biological factors, such as genes or brain chemistry
  • Life experiences, such as trauma or abuse

Behavioral/Mental Health problems are universal and we can help you get better and set you on a path of complete recovery.


 

Identify

Don’t suffer any longer.

 

Get Help

We are committed to providing the needed treatment for those who want to get well.

 

Succeed

Let us help you achieve your goals to a better life.


With our support you can overcome Behavioral/Mental Health Disorders.

Call us today at (919) 269-9300

title: Substance Abuse
content:
Substance Abuse is the misuse and abuse of alcohol, over-the-counter medications, illicit drugs, and tobacco. It’s the overindulgence in or dependence on an addictive substance.

Substance Abuse can lead to addiction and elevated health risks. It can modify a person’s judgement and/or thinking leading to life altering and destructive decisions.


Acknowledge

Don’t wait till it’s too late to get the treatment you need.

Achieve

We know with the proper treatment everyone can be successful in beating substance abuse.

Succeed

We’re here to help those who want to get on the road to recovery!


We can help you beat Substance Abuse.

Call us today at (919) 269-9300

title: History
content:
Stepping Stones Community Resources, Inc., established in 2012 under the leadership of Dr. Jessica Newton Banks. We are located in Wilson County, Wilson, North Carolina. In addition, we have DWI Services in Wilson North Carolina.

In 2013, 2016, 2019, and again in 2023, Stepping Stones Community Resources, Inc. was awarded a CARF (Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities) International Three-Year Accreditation making us globally recognized for our practice of excellence.

Accreditation demonstrates a provider’s commitment to continuously improve service quality and to focus on the satisfaction of the persons served.  


 

Quality Care

We are a licensed substance abuse and behavioral/mental health treatment facility providing treatment for adolescents, women and men.

 

Dependable

We are committed to providing needed services for those who have received a DWI.

 

Personalized

We help those who want to achieve their goal of living a better life.


We have a proven history of excellent care.

Call us today at (919) 269-9300

title: Mission
content:
Stepping Stones Community Resources, Inc. is committed to providing needed services to those in need and their families who are struggling with behavioral/mental and substance use disorders. We promote increased quality of life through strength based intervention and Person Centered Planning. We believe in transforming everyone’s potential into reality.


 

Quality Care

We are a licensed substance abuse and behavioral/mental health treatment facility providing treatment for adolescents, women and men.

 

Dependable

We are committed to providing needed services for those who have received a DWI.

 

Personalized

We help those who want to achieve their goal of living a better life.


It’s our Mission to help you.

Call us today at (919) 269-9300

title: Strategic Plan 2025-2026
excerpt: Our strategic plan for 2025–2026 outlines priorities for access, quality care, and community impact.
content:
Strategic Plan 2025–2026

This plan highlights our priorities for expanding access to care, strengthening outcomes, and supporting our community partners. More details and documentation will be added as the plan is finalized.

Focus Areas

  • Access to timely, person-centered services
  • Workforce development and staff support
  • Quality improvement and measurable outcomes
  • Community partnerships and prevention

title: Locations
excerpt: Explore how Stepping Stones supports people across our service areas in North Carolina.
content:
Our Service Areas

  • Wilson, NC
  • Rocky Mount, NC
  • Garysburg, NC
  • Lake Benson, NC

We offer outpatient treatment, assessments, and recovery support with a focus on respectful, person-centered care.

title: Wilson, NC
excerpt: Behavioral health and recovery support for Wilson, North Carolina.
content:
Residents of Wilson can access outpatient counseling, assessments, and recovery planning with our team. We focus on practical steps, clear expectations, and ongoing support.

Common needs we support:

  • Outpatient therapy and counseling
  • Substance use assessments
  • Case management and care coordination

Call to learn how services start and what happens next.

title: Rocky Mount, NC
excerpt: Behavioral health and recovery support for Rocky Mount, North Carolina.
content:
People in Rocky Mount can connect with Stepping Stones for outpatient services and recovery support. We explain options clearly and help you take the next step.

Services often requested:

  • Clinical assessments
  • Outpatient treatment planning
  • Support for families and caregivers

Call to discuss scheduling and next steps.

title: Garysburg, NC
excerpt: Behavioral health and recovery support for Garysburg, North Carolina.
content:
For Garysburg residents, we offer evidence-informed outpatient care with a focus on safety, respect, and clear guidance. Our team helps you understand your options.

We can help with:

  • Outpatient counseling
  • Recovery planning
  • Care coordination and referrals

Call to learn how to get started.

title: Lake Benson, NC
excerpt: Behavioral health and recovery support for Lake Benson, North Carolina.
content:
Lake Benson community members can reach Stepping Stones for outpatient services and recovery education. We outline what to expect and how care begins.

Services include:

  • Comprehensive assessments
  • Outpatient therapy
  • Case management support

Call to discuss your situation and next steps.
